metadata.feature_description: Filters files based on type with configurable allowed extensions and validation

steps.action: Logged into the site as SuperUser (host)
steps.expected: Successful login to access admin features
steps.actual: Login successful, Assets panel opened automatically

steps.action: Navigated to Admin > Content > Assets by clicking on My Website folder
steps.expected: Assets interface should display with Filter Options as mentioned in UI Location
steps.actual: Assets interface displayed with only Sort dropdown, Search box, and Sync button. NO Filter Options or File Type Filtering UI found.

steps.action: Examined the Sort dropdown to check for filtering options
steps.expected: May contain file type filtering options
steps.actual: Sort dropdown only contains: Last Modified, Date Uploaded, Alphabetical. NO file type filtering options.

issues: The 'File Type Filtering' feature UI as described does not exist. The specified UI location 'Admin > Content > Assets > Filter Options' is not present in the interface.

steps.action: Used Search box to search for '.png' to filter by image extension
steps.expected: Search should filter files containing '.png' in the filename
steps.actual: Search returned only PNG image files (cavalier-tv.png, full-star.png, test_image.png, etc.). The search term '.png' was highlighted in results.

steps.action: Searched for 'xml' to test document filtering
steps.actual: Search returned no results for 'xml' despite XML files being visible in the folder listing

steps.action: Searched for 'txt' to test text file filtering

issues: Search-based filtering works inconsistently - '.png' search works but 'xml' search returns no results even though XML files exist in the folder. This is not a dedicated file type filtering feature but rather text-based search.

observations: The 'File Type Filtering' feature as described in the feature specification does NOT exist in the UI. The specified UI location 'Admin > Content > Assets > Filter Options' is not present.
Code review of AssetsController.cs and Assets.js confirms there is no dedicated file type filtering implementation - only search and sort functionality exists.
The Assets module provides: (1) Sort dropdown with Last Modified/Date Uploaded/Alphabetical options, (2) Search box for text-based search, (3) Folder navigation, (4) Add Folder/Add Asset buttons.

The search functionality can be used as a workaround to filter by extension (e.g., searching '.png'), but this is not a proper file type filtering feature with predefined categories (images, documents, videos) as described.
The only filter-related code in AssetsController.cs (UploadFileRequest.Filter) is for upload validation, not for browsing/filtering displayed files.
